tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: 72 Hours Clause (GGHQ mwd also see Hours Clause)
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: All loss, destruction or DAMAGE: A. caused by all earthquake shocks arising out of a single seismic disturbance and occurring within a period of seventy two consecutive hours, or B. caused by storm DAMAGE arising out of a single atmospheric disturbance and occurring within a period of seventy two consecutive hours, or C. caused by inundation from the sea or the rising, overflowing or breaking of boundaries of any lake, pond, reservoir, river, stream or other body of water, all whether or not driven by wind, and occurring within a period of seventy two consecutive hours shall be deemed to have been caused by a single INCIDENT

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein this Policy does not cover any liability assumed by The Insured for Loss or Damage directly or indirectly occasioned by, happening through or in consequence of war, invasion, acts of foreign enemies, hostilities or war-like operations (whether war be declared or not), civil war, mutiny, civil commotion assuming the proportions of or amounting to popular rising, military rising, insurrection, rebellion, revolution, military or usurped power, martial law, confiscation or nationalisation or requisition or destruction of or damage to property by or under the order of any Government or public or local authority, or any act of any person or persons acting on behalf of or in connection with any organisation the objects of which are Terrorism.
This insurance does not cover the risks of injury to persons or damage to property caused by radiation from nuclear reactor sites or by nuclear matter in the course of carriage.
TSUNAMI: An ocean wave generated by a submarine earthquake, volcano or landslide.
The sudden occurrence of a violent discharge of steam and volcanic material from a Volcano.

An avalanche is a very large slide of snow or rock down a mountainside, caused when a buildup of snow is released down a slope, and is one of the major dangers faced in the mountains. An avalanche consists of rapidly moving granular material that has exceeded the critical static friction threshold and thereby causes additional material to exceed its threshold as well, in a cascading effect.
Wear,Tear and gradual deterioration caused by the day to day use of any Building, Plant or Machinery.

Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary within this insurance or any endorsement thereto it is agreed that this insurance excludes Loss, Damage, cost or expense of whatsoever nature directly or indirectly caused by, resulting from or in connection with any act of Terrorism regardless of any other cause or event contributing concurrently or in any other sequence to the Loss. This clause also excludes Loss, Damage, cost or expense of whatsoever nature directly or indirectly caused by, resulting from or in connection with any action taken in controlling, preventing, suppressing or in any way relating to any act of Terrorism. If The Insurers allege that by reason of this exclusion, any Loss, Damage, cost or expense is not covered by this insurance the burden of proving the contrary shall be upon The Insured. In the event any portion of this endorsement is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder shall remain in full force and effect.

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Automobiles, Motorcycles and all Vehicles submitted to compulsory insurance
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Usually excluded all the vehicles that can circulate on the public road as Automobiles, Motocycles and all Vehicles submitted to compulsory insurance.
Faulty design of the product, use of faulty materials , faulty workmanship and errors and ommissions.

Policy excludes Damage cost or expense of whatsoever nature directly or indirectly caused by or resulting from or in connection with the actual or threatened malicious use of pathogenic or poisonous biological or chemical materials regardless of any other cause or event contributing concurrently or in any other sequence thereto.
Seepage Pollution and Contamination of the Property insured is excluded unless such Pollution or Contamination is caused by an Insured Peril under the policy.

Failure to Supply: Coverage arising out of the: 1) Complete or partial failure to supply electricity, gas, oil, steam or water; 2) Complete or partial return, after the failure, of the supply of electricity, gas, oil, steam or water; 3) Production of excessive electrical current or the overloading of any power or supply line. This exclusion does not apply if the failure to supply results from the sudden and accidental injury to tangible property owned or used by any Insured to procure, produce, process or transmit gas, oil, water, electricity or steam.

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Inland Transit - transportation outside insured's premises
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Cover provided to the Insured for the inland carriage of Goods within a Territory.

Gross Negligence: a civil wrong whereby the Insured is in breach of a legal duty of care resulting in physical injury to another party. (Text) The Company shall not be liable in respect of any Liability in whole or in part, directly or indirectly out of an act or acts of Gross Negligence of the Insured.

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Fraud and Dishonesty of Insured's employees
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Loss or Damage caused by Fraud or Dishonesty of the Insured's employees.

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Theft and Robbery including forcible entry for Goods and Contents
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Theft and or Robbery and or Burglary following forcible, visible and violent entry into or exit from the Insured Property.
Excluding Damage ibn respect of land, roads or pavements,piers, jetties, bridges, culverts and construction
Loss or Damage to Land, Trees, Standing Crops, Animals (normally excluded).

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Jewellery Precious Stones, Gold, Furs and Garments
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: An All Risks policy will normally exclude Loss or Damage to Jewellery, Precious Stones, Gold, Furs and Garments unless specifially covered under the same policy.

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Off-Shore property, off shore activity, drilling and oil production activity on land
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Covering installations and activities connected with the offshore exploration and production of oil or gas by mobile and non-mobile installations. The risks run from the construction on land, the pipelines and pumping stations up to and including the operation period.
Cover loss or damage to property in underground mine workings including any property contained therein.
Loss or Damage to Aircraft and Watercrafts
Loss or Damage to Fine Arts, Paintings, "Objet's d'Art" unless specifically covered

tns1:Clause.tns3:FullName: Automobiles, Motorcycles and all Vehicles submitted to compulsory insurance
tns1:Clause.tns1:Wording: Usually excluded all the vehicles that can circulate on the public road as Automobiles, Motocycles and all Vehicles submitted to compulsory insurance.

tns1:Clause.tns3:DescText: Coverage that can be purchased as an endorsement to many property policies such as the standard fire policy or as a separate policy. Coverage is for direct damage resulting from earthquake (or also volcanic eruption). If there is a lapse of at least 72 hours between earthquake shocks then each loss by a given earthquake is subject to a new claim (see special clause). Excluded are consecuent losses resulting from fire, explosion, flood or tidal wave. (See)

tns1:SiCCode.tns3:Description: Establishments primarily engaged in manufacturing special industry machinery, not elsewhere classified, such as smelting and refining equipment, cement making, clayworking and tempering, cotton ginning, glass making, hat making, incandescent lamp making, leather working, paint making, rubber working, cigar and cigarette making, tobacco working, shoe making and repairing, and stone working machinery, and industrial sewing machines, and automotive maintenance machinery and equipment. Other products include ammunition and explosives loading machinery; anodizing equipment (except rolling mill lines); bag sewing and closing machines (industrial sewing machines); balancing equipment, automotive wheel; boot making and repairing machinery; brick making machines; broom making machinery; buttonhole and eyelet machines and attachments, industrial; chemical kilns; chemical machinery and equipment; concrete products machinery; control rod drive mechanisms for use on nuclear reactors; cork working machinery; degreasing machines, automotive (garage equipment); degreasing machines, industrial; desalination equipment; die and hub cutting equipment (jewelry manufacturing); drying kilns, lumber; electric screening equipment; electron tube making machinery; electroplating machinery and equipment, except rolling mill lines; foundry machinery and equipment; frame straighteners, automotive (garage equipment); fur sewing machines; glass making machinery: blowing, molding, forming, grinding, etc.; hat making and hat renovating machinery; jewelers’ machines; kilns: cement, wood, and chemical; metal finishing equipment for plating, except rolling mill lines; metal pickling equipment, except rolling mill lines; metal smelting and refining machinery, except furnaces and ovens; optical lens machinery; ozone machines; packup assemblies (wheel overhaul); petroleum refinery equipment; pharmaceutical machinery; plastics working machinery; pottery making machinery; robots, plastics: for molding and forming; rubber products machinery; scouring machines, tannery; semiconductor manufacturing machinery; sewing machines and attachments, industrial; silver recovery equipment, electrolytic; stone tumblers; synthetic filament extruding machines; tannery machines; tile making machines; tire grooving machines; tire retreading machinery and equipment; tire shredding machinery; wheel mounting and balancing equipment, automotive; wood drying kilns; zipper making machinery; etc.
